The Bioshock series is one of the best series I've ever laid my hands one, the movement, the gameplay, the rich story line and story telling is out of these world, and Bioshock Infinite is arguably one of the best in the entire series.
It has so much improvement, to graphics and gameplay but player's UI it was a step back, you can only have 2 Weapons equipped and 2 plasmids (Although there is a wheel were you can pick wichever you want in battle), also you can't manually save the game, you have to reach a respawn point.
Overall this game it's absolutely amazing and you should buy it with DLC's included

中文死活开不了，一进游戏就黑屏，全屏模式下还没法关掉游戏，（任务管理器都不管用）只能不断地重启电脑。
英文倒是没问题。
网上搜了一堆办法包括但不限于用补丁汉化游戏用英文启动游戏，均失败。
不断尝试下，最后发现用兼容性疑难解答-尝试建议的设置-测试程序，这样的方式启动Steam\steamapps\common\BioShock Infinite\Binaries\Win32下的BioShockInfinite.exe，就可以正常打开。
就算改了兼容性，但直接双击BioShockInfinite.exe还是无法正常打开，所以每次开游戏都得来一遍上面的流程，用“测试程序”来开启游戏。
如果有人遇到一样的情况，可以试试。（如果还是失败，可以先按照网上说的那些通常方法都试一遍再试试我这个）
当然如果有更方便的方法也请通知我。

=========
最近发现管理员运行也可以正常打开游戏，总之随缘吧.jpg

I was going to recommend this as a competently done First Person Shooter.  The more I wrote, however; the more I realized that I DON'T recommend this game.  As a game it's not bad; it's even pretty good.  There are several issues that make me not recommend it. First was the ham-fisted moralizing of the game, which could be summed up as "America is racist, diversity is our strength, borders are bad, and religion probably is, too".  This, in and of itself could have been tolerated, but the fact that it got to the level of sermonizing at times, just made it grating.  I also kind of hated the ridiculous multiverse nonsense. The final issue was the fact that none of the characters actually managed to rise to the level of being interesting enough for me to remember them.  All in all, I enjoyed playing it, but was not a fan of the story or characters.  I can't really recommend this, because there are any number of decent FPS's out there to spend your money on.  Go play one of those.

1. It's not bioshock (only the audio and one word, "plasmid" carries over from the original bioshock)
2. Plays like a shallow tech demo (not bioshock)
3. Insultingly lazy non-story and anti-plot development.
4. Zero consequences. (Again, not a bioschock game)
5. Extremely simple and easy combat, also insulting 
6. It's just a gross attempt to market the nostalgia and success of the original bioshocks. This game would be 100% acceptable and a solid two thumbs up if it wasn't trying to bait you into thinking this was a continuation of the franchise. There's only one DLC which supposedly ties in to old Rapture but also retcons the base Inifinity story ending... so many contradictions and lack of features trying to take us for a joyride. I can't find any conditions under which to play this game and enjoy it while respecting one's own consumer quality standards. This game is the epitome of lacking standards in the studio production world of game development.

bioception

时隔6年的正统续作，但并没看到太多进步，甚至在一些方面还有退步，是一部完成度不太能令人满意的作品。

作为FPS游戏在射击手感上有进步，也与时俱进加入了机瞄，但武器不明所以的缩减到只能携带2种，并且取消了前作的多种子弹选择，武器的升级也变成了简单的伤害、后坐力和弹匣量等，没有了前作3级武器的特殊效果，因此战斗层面缺少了很多变化，到后期明显有些枯燥。

质体方面变化比较多，长按释放的质体大部分都变成了陷阱，焚化变成了燃烧弹，魅惑综合了催眠和安保命令的效果，虫群换成了鸦群，唯有闪电还是老样子。新增的几个质体里，飓风冲击就是大老爹的冲撞，暗潮只有对爱国者的时候比较好用，护盾持续时间太短不实用，唯有奔腾野马足够强势，可以让范围内的敌人处于浮空状态，失去战斗能力，持续时间也足够长，是面对大波敌人的必备技能。另外本作还加入了质体的连携效果，比如对浮空的敌人扔燃烧弹似乎可以引发爆炸等等，需要玩家自己探索。
和武器类似，质体的升级也都集中在增伤减耗的层面，缺少能带来技能效果变化的升级。并且质体和场景互动的地方极少，闪电开门只在刚拿到质体的地方遇到过一次，除了点汽油桶其他技能基本都是纯战斗向的，像前作的焚化解冻，隔空取物搜刮资源这些玩法都没得到继承，很是遗憾。

新增的服装系统可以认为取代了被动质体的地位，有些衣服的效果能给质体增加特殊效果，也算是弥补了一点升级单调的问题。

如果说前面所讲的都可以用变化总是有好有坏来解释，那么hack系统的完全缺席应该就是开倒车了。也许大家对于hack小游戏都或多或少有些微词，但作为初代的主要系统之一，破解摄像头让敌人触发警报，看着无人机大队痛打修补者，悄悄破解炮台反客为主，医疗站放毒补刀，这些有趣的玩法都实打实的为我们在危机四伏的销魂城生存下去提供了帮助，以及，不用被无人机追着四处找警报开关，就也还挺寂寞的。

本作新增的滑轨系统虽然全篇的存在感都很强，但是除了满足设定以外，战斗中实用性不足，高速滑行中武器瞄准困难，并且还容易成为靶子，质体也很难使用，尤其后期高空袭击连敌人半血都打不掉后，彻底失去使用价值。而裂隙嘛，明明是一个很好的解谜元素，但大部分场景中裂隙都没有什么用武之地，基本沦为战斗辅助，还是存在感很低的那种。

剧情方面，并没有沿袭前作的路子，天空之城哥伦比亚仅仅只作为了故事发生的背景，那些对种族主义，工人GM，宗教以及乌托邦的描绘都只是浅尝辄止，一带而过，重心都放在了角色塑造和呈现故事上。伊丽莎白，作为女主角在剧情演出中的表现还是很棒的，但作为同伴，并没有带给我特别惊艳的感觉，尤其她像哆啦A梦一样不停往外掏子弹、掏金币、掏急救包的时候工具人的感觉就特别强烈。另外一个重要的NPC，神出鬼没的卢特斯双胞胎也让人印象深刻，在故事还处于一片朦胧的时候增添了一份诡异的气息。为避免剧透，故事就不详说了，只是叙事上感觉可以安排的更好一些，至少我个人如果不借助一些分析文章对于故事还是处于一知半解的状态。

另外也简单谈谈海葬吧，作为系列实际的终章，回到销魂城的整体氛围都不输初代，服装店里修补者伪装成模特这种传统艺能又回来了，很亲切（大误）。gameplay有改进，甚至还加入了潜行，但依然欠缺设计，隐身技能太过破坏平衡，不用又很难刚正面。以及，虽然很理解肯.列文想亲手终结系列，但对这个结局还是有点接受不能，明明一切都可以不是这样的。

海底之城与云上之城，幽暗与明媚，销魂城与哥伦比亚就像是阴阳两极，彼此对立，但又密不可分。
这是生化奇兵的终结，也是开始。

This is master piece! It's amazing how Irrational changed the classic Rapture for Columbia (at least for the main story), I felt safe for once :'D [spoiler] Just in the entrance of Columbia lol [/spoiler] .


I loved the fact that Booker is the first character that has his own personality, not like Jack or Delta but... it brings some trouble with it cuz he sometimes chooses by himself [strike] just like Andrew Ryan says [/strike] .


I also had to turn off some visual effects in the game files due to my computer and....accidentally deactivated a thing that triggers some events in the game like the "heads or tails" event and the "raffle" event, had to turn that on and everything was fixed.

Conclusion: I enjoyed this game without those visual effects, the story was amazing, it was so immersive that I felt like i was there, living everything, Being Booker Dewitt and Elizabeth Comstock in burial at sea.

My first thought was "whoa, impressive visuals, but the story stinks of another cliché monomyth repetition". Now I cannot express how wrong I was. In fact, the story in this game breaks it in the most original way I have ever experienced.

Let's start from the main protagonist. In Jungian's palette of archetypes, Booker takes a role of Hero, who has to rescue the Innocent - Elizabeth, but quickly gains another one, which defines the whole conflict and leads to unexpected outcome. After introducing Comstock, main antagonist wielding powerful combo of the Ruler, Sage and Magician, Booker gains a mark of the False Shepherd and becomes his counterweight, like reversed card in Tarot. But the authors didn't end up yet. Throughout his journey we can even taste the impression of becoming Explorer and the Rebel, two another powerful archetypes. Elizabeth's figure in this story is not left behind. We learn quickly that she is also an Orphan and later she transforms into the Creator, thanks to her extraordinary abilities. This shapeshifting and juggling archetypes proves that characters in this game are not only dynamic, but more human, because people's mind is not so stable as we tend to think and it can be easily shaken by unexpected event. The title 'Infinite' is also interesting, especially after reaching the ending, as it suggests that this 'Hero's Journey', the whole cycle of death and reborn will last forever like Saṃsāra, or at least until we truly die along with our whole hidden personalities and consciousness and achieve Nirvana, often described as total emptiness.

And so with emptiness I was left after finishing this game, with hands shaken and jaw dropped. Of course there are a lot more interpretations, such as projection of Booker's suffering mind after losing someone important in his life or the reference to Hawking's theory of infite worlds. I consider this my favourite game and the best one I have ever played, because it touches gently the nature of humanity, reaches deeply to the core of any relligion while offering relaxing gameplay, pleasurable shooting experience and breathtaking visuals.

6/10

Why can i have only 2 guns?! It makes the whole weapon upgrade system useless and to top it of, their look doesn't change with upgrades like in the 1st one, even though that was like the best thing in any videogame ever. Some levels were meh, and the level with a dead witch lady suck fuckin dick, dirty fuckin foreskin fucker, I ain't ever playing that level again cause I'd have to shoot myself in the head with my upgraded shotgun but oh no, what's that? I can't do it cause it's not lying around at this moment and im in a sniper level so i gotta use sniper rifle anyway! Many people said that previous games were much better in atmosphere cause of their less narrative nature, and i agree with em. I can't say i hated it or was perticulary dissapointed, i still enjoyed it for what it was, but i can see how negatively that affects replayability. And the lack of choice in approaching the levels just sucks kinda, it's more of a laid back style gameplay, where you just kinda sit back, watch beautiful sceneries, listen to interesting story, and kill a bunch of people here and there. If you play the game with this in mind, then it's enjoyable for what it is, but you'll just be dissapointed if you expect another bioshock experience, which i think was better. Nontheless, i still enjoyed it for what it is, but i don't really see myself replaying it any time soon. The story that is higly praised for being heartbreaking and emotionally heavy, was from my point of view very interesting and it was a nice ride, but not hearbreaking nor emotionally heavy. I feel like it was a nice complicated puzzle that was slowly coming together, and it was fun to watch cause it was pretty interesting and unique in it's way, but that's it. I am a man of heart and soul, some games aren't pretty but have great heart, and some games are gorgeous, but don't have much heart and empathy to them. That's bioshock infinite. I'm not saying that it's bad, I think that it's a beautiful game, with fun laid back FPS gameplay and a very interesting pretty story. But that's it. Fun ride I enjoyed, but nothing more, hope you understand what i mean with that. And also fuck that fuckin witch level nigga seriously man, anyone who is responsible for that atrocious level should be devoured alive by a fuckin aligator. AND also, DLCs are equally good as the base game and it's a nice change of gameplay mechanics for a while with some more interesting cool story so if you enjoyed the game i recommend them as well. Thank you, that's all
